author: Gerard Lye
title: 2017 World Car Awards – top three finalists list out
text:
/ 0 comments 
The 2017 World Car Awards moves on to its next stage, with the announcement of the top three finalists in six award categories at the ongoing Geneva Motor Show. Following this, the winners of each category will be announced at the New York International Auto Show in April. 
The six categories are as follows: World Car of the Year, World Luxury Car, World Performance Car, World Green Car, World Car Design of the Year and World Urban Car. That last one is a new category addition to the awards. 
Selecting the top three finalists in each category was done by secret ballot, where a 75-person jury will evaluate each candidate before casting their vote. The jury is made up of 75 international automotive journalists from 23 countries. 
In 2016, the Mazda MX-5 was awarded World Car of the Year, besting the B9 Audi A4 and Mercedes-Benz GLC. The roadster also secured another award that year – the World Car Design of the Year – which also included the Jaguar XE and the CX-3. 
Other winners in 2016 include the Audi R8 Coupe for the World Performance Car award, the G11 BMW 7 Series for the World Luxury Car award, and Toyota Mirai for the World Green Car award.
